content: Nicolò Cavalleri has marked this topic as resolved.
What is the name of a general unary operation α → α? I only know this as "endomorphism".

Yaël Dillies said:

What is the name of a general unary operation α → α? I only know this as "endomorphism".

The proper mathematical name is "unary operation". The word "endomorphism" means a unary operation that is a homomorphism.

I believe this is the standard terminology of unary functions:
https://github.com/madvorak/web/blob/main/stuff/Unary_functions.pdf
A bare function is a homomorphism in the category Type* so I don't really see what's wrong. :shrug:
Most importantly, we also have other End definitions in other categories. Eg docs#monoid_hom.End
Ah sorry; I don't understand the terminology of category theory. I just vaguely know that it is different from normal math and that they sometimes reuse the same words for different things.
Is α → β a "unary operation" under your terminology?
No. That is a unary function.
Unary operation is a special case where α = β.
Do you have a reference for that meaning? It seems reasonable, but I've never heard the claim that "operation means homogenous types" before
I will have to look it up. I thought that "function" and "operation" were so much standard words that I didn't consult the literature for this part.
Wikipedia claims "Operation (mathematics)" applies in the heterogenous case too
Short answer: People don't agree on what "operation" means. However, at least in my native language (Czech: funkce, operace), most people would agree with my interpretation.
I think Martin's usage is quite standard, which of course doesn't rule out the possibility that other usages could also be standard.

It seems that many English-speaking people agree with me as well, for example:
https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/1337355/what-is-the-difference-between-functions-and-operations
That said, if we want to proceed and discuss how to name stuff in mathlib, we should start a new topic.

Yaël Dillies said:

What is the name of a general unary operation α → α? I only know this as "endomorphism".

Haskell would agree with you on this, you could use haskells Monoid Endo instance's mconcat function to basically achieve the above

I would be quite surprised to see an arbitrary function between sets/types called a "morphism" unless talking explicitly about the categorical properties of Set\mathbf{Set}Set or Type\mathbf{Type}Type.
I believe most of mathlib is tailored for a "usual mathematician" rather than a category theorist.
